programmes.show_description: An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
...Honeymoon, Honeymurder: Murder mystery with Candace Cameron Bure. Newly-married Aurora and Nick's lakeside getaway takes a decidedly unromantic turn when they discover a body in the water. (2021)

Deadly drama with Anna Hutchinson. A woman arrives at her fianc√©'s family estate for their upcoming nuptials, only to discover that someone is out to stop the wedding - even if it means murder (2019).

Thriller with Bree Williamson. Karina suspects something isn't right about Lena and her daughter, Mallie. But Mallie is all Lena has, and she isn't about to give up her secrets, or her child... (2020)
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Pilot - Part 1: Sue Thomas moves to Washington, DC to start her new career with the FBI. Will her exceptional ability to read people's lips lead to a more rewarding role within the bureau?

Join officers from New Zealand Police as they patrol the streets and race to the scene of real-life emergency calls.
Down Among the Dead Men: Steve is stunned when he starts to receive a series of notes outlining crimes moments before they are committed.
...For Murder: Crime mystery starring Jewel. When Shannon finds a body in the house she's been hired to renovate, can this unlikely sleuth dust off the clues and crack a murder case too? (2017)

Crime mystery with Alison Sweeney. After a man is found dead in a pond, his wife is put on trial for murder. Podcaster Alex McPherson is convinced she's innocent, but can she prove it in time? (2019)

...Told: Experts at delivering the undeliverable, the postal detectives take on a brand-new mission: getting a soldier's letter to a bullied teen. (2015)

While on vacation, a happy-go-lucky family becomes the unsuspected target of a grieving mother who lost her family. Starring Nicky Whelan. (2019)
Thriller starring Chrishell Stause. When a popular talk show host reunites with her college co-host, the show's success skyrockets, but her personal life falls apart (2019).
Troy Story: Sue is taken aback when her informant and friend, Troy, is arrested as an accomplice in an armed robbery.

An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Love Is Murder: Dr Sloan suspects that a recent spate of suicides involving policemen could be the work of a serial killer. Mark fears that Steve could be the murderer's next target.
...Beautiful Place To Die: Thriller starring Jesse Metcalfe. A retired detective's quiet life is shattered when a body washes up to shore, but can he track down the murderer? (2020)
Murder In White: Jessica travels to London to help with the stage adaptation of her novel. Can she prove that her friend, the leading lady in the play, is innocent of murder?
Northern Explosion: Jessica investigates the murders of two men in rural Canada.
Proof In The Pudding: Jessica investigates the murder of a TV chef, killed on the opening night of his new restaurant.
Portrait Of Death: Jessica finds herself heavily involved in the New York art scene when a gallery owner is murdered with one of her friend's sculptures.
Deadly Assets: Can Jessica prove whether a Cabot Cove fisherman is innocent of murdering a Chicago hitman?
Murder On The Thirtieth Floor: Jessica investigates the apparent suicide of her book editor in New York.
Time To Die: Jessica investigates after one of her student's is accused of murdering his stepfather.
The Dying Game: Jessica investigates the murders of two men involved in the sale of a prominent New York building.
The Trouble With Seth: Jessica and Sheriff Metzger become increasingly concerned about Dr Hazlitt after he suspiciously disappears.
Roadkill: Jessica travels to Houston to research her new book. Can she help her friend's son when he is accused of murder?
...Drink and Be Buried: Crime sequel starring Dylan Neal. Culinary whiz Harry is hired to work a summer gala, but soon finds himself caught up in a murder mystery. Also starring Brooke Burns. (2017)
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.

...Day: Crime thriller starring Dylan Neal. After buying a rare cookery book, chef Henry finds himself at the centre of a murder mystery. Can the answers be found within the book itself? (2020)
